name: Pope Nicholas IV
summary: Nicholas IV, born Girolamo Masci, was Pope from 1288 to 1292. He was the first Franciscan pope. He worked to organize a crusade and supported missionary efforts, particularly in Asia. He sent missionaries to China and worked to establish diplomatic relations with various Eastern powers. He canonized St. Louis of Toulouse and worked to support the Franciscan order. His pontificate was marked by efforts to expand the Church's influence through missions and diplomacy.
